timeline.message: Take periodic thread dump to see what's going on

Add more useful methods to `AsyncCloseable`

Motivation:

When a user closes something asynchronously, it is likely that he or she
wants the following functionalities:

- Getting notified when it is closed, sometimes even without closing it.
- Using with `try`-with-resources.

Modifications:

- Make `AsyncCloseable` extend `AutoCloseable`.
- Add `AsyncCloseable.closeFuture()` which allows a user to get the
  close future without closing.
- Add `AsyncCloseableSupport` which helps a user implement `AsyncCloseable`.
- Made the following classes implement `AsyncCloseable`:
  - `ClientFactory`
  - `HttpChannelPool`
  - `Server`
  - `StartStopSupport`
- Stopped using `Mockito.spy()` in `StartStopSupportTest` because can't
  test with spies.
- Fixed a dead lock in `HealthCheckedEndpointGroupTest.delegateUpdateCandidatesWhileCreatingHealthCheckedEndpointGroup()`

Result:

- `ClientFactory` and `Server` can be closed asynchronously.
- A user can do something when a `ClientFactory` closes, which will be
  useful for https://github.com/line/armeria/issues/1084#issuecomment-572481160

Disallow starting after closing / Return unupdatable future

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't we use CompletableFutures.succesfulAsList(...) (log the cause using defaultValueMapper) because we have to wait for all futures to be complete? never mind this. 😅
timeline.author: minwoox

timeline.bodyText:
need to change the doc a little bit?
Unlike {@link AutoCloseable}, -> In addition to the funcationality of closing synchronously with {@link AutoCloseable},
timeline.author: minwoox
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -22,12 +22,24 @@
  * method releases the resources asynchronously, returning the {@link CompletableFuture} which is completed

timeline.bodyText: Not sure if we need this method, but if we do, how about making a static variable for this?
timeline.author: minwoox
ikhoon

timeline.bodyText: nit: Use singleton EMPTY_FUTURES like HttpClientFactory?
timeline.author: ikhoon

timeline.bodyText: nit: Don't we need to add the breaking-change label? 🧐
timeline.author: ikhoon
ikhoon

replies.bodyText: Thought about it, but ? super does not make sense here, because the consumer must call CompletableFuture.complete*(). A consumer that accepts a CompletionStage or Object cannot do that.
replies.author: trustin
ikhoon

replies.bodyText:
Yeah it compiles, but what I'm saying is this doesn't make sense:
Consumer<CompletionStage<?>> consumer = stage -> ...; // Can't call complete()
AsyncCloseableSupport.of(consumer); // This doesn't make sense. Consumer must call .complete().
replies.author: trustin

replies.bodyText:
Consumer must call .complete().

I understood. You may want to constrain consumer implementation. It makes sense to me. 👍
replies.author: ikhoon

timeline.author: ikhoon

timeline.bodyText: Can you add a comment why we don't use join() here? I think this is basically only called from a shutdown hook ever, so interruption probably doesn't matter so much but not sure.
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: It's because it may not be invoked from a shutdown hook? Nothing stops a user from calling this method manually (or automatically via some framework).
replies.author: trustin

timeline.bodyText:
Having two similar names with same return type is making me scratch my head a little. It looks like future is a way of closing out of these three

(Implicitly implied) Blocking close
Async close
Future close

I know this matches our general pattern, but shall we consider renaming all fooFuture to whenFoo? ctx.log().whenComplete().thenAccept() reads like English and seems quite nice to me.
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: That's a good idea. Let me rename. whenClosed(), then?
replies.author: trustin

timeline.message:
Make `UnmodifiableFuture` a part of the public API

.. because it's so useful

timeline.bodyText: nit: This one should be ListenableAsyncCloseable as well.
timeline.author: minwoox
minwoox
minwoox

  • {@link #obtrudeException(Throwable)}

replies.bodyText: On second thought, it's better to return UnmodifiableFuture. 😉 Sorry about the noise.
replies.author: minwoox

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure. It's like ImmutableList.of() returns an ImmutableList instead of a List. We might add more public API to it later as well.
replies.author: trustin

timeline.message: Remove `Completable` from all `CompletableFuture` subclasses for brevity, as suggested by @minwoox
